title: Great app and system!
text: We‚Äôve had our Abode system since it was first introduced in 2019 and haven‚Äôt had a single hiccup or even had to reboot it once. Set-up of devices has been easy, including Abode window/door sensors, Zigbee water leak sensors, and a Z-Wave water main shut-off valve, triggered by leak sensors we placed below pipes in the crawl space under the house. Through firmware updates that are advertised via the Abode app, they‚Äôve added HomeKit and have simplified features, making things ever more simple the longer we‚Äôve had the system. Alerts for home monitoring took some time to set up but all was relatively straightforward once I figured it out. I‚Äôd suggest that the Abode team recommend some standard alerts (I.e. send me a notification if someone leaves a door open for more than 20 minutes, etc.) to introduce how the app can be used to simplify life at (or away from) home. It‚Äôs amazing how the system just works with any home automation part we can find. 10/10!

title: It‚Äôs fine
text:
There is a lot to love over the competition (HomeKit, cheaper fees, lots of different sensors) but just as much I don‚Äôt like. The over all product experience is surpassingly rough for a 4+ year old company. 

For example adding a bunch of sensors at once, every 5th one seems to make the app hang and leave the sensor in limbo. Force quite, re-open, remove sensor, force quite so it‚Äôs internal cache doesn‚Äôt get confused, re-add. That‚Äôs dumb. 

The industrial design is basic. Just barely passable compared to pretty much everyone but old school SimpliSafe or hardwired ADT. If you can do the embedded or slim sensors, I‚Äôd go that route. The sounds it makes are also unpleasant and the integrations to make custom sounds are so slow you might as well not have them. People have been asking for good sound for literally years and nothing changes‚Ä¶

Performance is also meh. Supposedly can cover large houses but I have some sensors that trigger open but never trigger back to closed. Move closer and it works just fine. Rapidly open and closing a door often SKIPS an alert. It‚Äôs conceivable that such a lag is a security concern. HomeKit support is top notch, it‚Äôs as fast and as accurate as the underlying Abode bridge. 

At the end of the day I wish I would have stuck with SimpliSafe. It‚Äôs more expensive and has no official HomeKit support, but at least it‚Äôs a rock solid and nicely designed system.

title: System works as expected, app is under developed
text:
The Abode system itself has been working just as expected. I haven't had any issues with the sensors, and the ability to have a cellular backup in the case of a power outage far outweighs the struggles of the growing brand. 

The app and the user interface of the system is complex and confusing so it takes awhile to learn. 
1- The arm and disarm functions in the app is a very tiny icon in the upper corner. Easy to overlook and hard to access. 
2- There is no way to set off the alarm in the case of an emergency. For example, if someone breaks through your window while you are home and you don't have the glass break sensors on that window, you'd have to arm your system and then go set off one of your sensors to make the alarm go off. They do have a way to set a button on your keyfob to a panic button, but you run into the same issue. If you are unable to reach your keyfob, or if you aren't even home but can see someone lurking around outside the house through a camera, you're out of luck. The only work around is creating a "action" where you can click the button on your app and it can be set to send a specific message to an emergency contact, or you personally can call the police. But most people have a DIY alarm system to scare off intruders, so the alarm itself does the grunt work. 
3- As other users have mentioned, the app itself has a lot of buttons that give you a pop up to "go to the browser" and no actual app functionality. Then the browser on a smaller screen is just as useless. They have buttons on the far edge of lines that you can't see from a phone, so you are forced to use a tablet or computer.
4- It would be a huge benefit to have a larger selection of arm modes similar to how ismartalarm has set it up. I usually prefer to have an Away (everything armed with delayed entry), Home (back door unarmed to let dogs in and out), Sleep (immediately alarms), Maintenance (notification if someone enters but no alarm), and a Standby. Right now Abode only gives you 3 options which can be customized to your preference "standby", "home", "away". 
5- This may be more my fault than Abode, but I still haven't figured out how to make Abode call me if the alarm is triggered. I know you can do it through the IFTTT, but testing it hasn't been successful yet. **update** you can set it up the IFTTT and it works just as expected!
6- If you exit the app screen it automatically locks you out. I have my phone fingerprint protected so the only one able to access the app is me. It would be helpful to choose how long you'd stay logged in. **update** to fix this you can disable Touch ID in the settings. Then you will no longer have to login each time you re-enter the app. 
7- Automations are wonderful. I haven't experienced any downfall or issues with them, other than you can't edit them in the app (see line item 3). **update** the location services drained my batter (like abode alone used of 44%) so some automations are a battery killer. 
8- No way to give feedback to the developers of the app. **update** you can email support center and they can forward to the developers. 

Overall I would still recommend Abode. It is a great system that I think will only get better. Hopefully some of the functionalities, like the panic button in the app, that are standard in other systems will will be added in soon. **update** I'm still very happy with my purchase!

I received my kit today and started setting up the hardware around the house. I launched up the Abode app since the thank you email said so. I set up my gateway and the sensors. I got this system since its the only one that‚Äôs HomeKit compatible (without hassle, that is). Well, after a glitchy update from the hardware, I went to adjust the motion sensors and door sensors for the Away and Home scenes. I could not get them to stay at the setting I wanted! After 20 minutes I gave up. I noticed that the app said I had to upgrade to the pro plan to use some features. I knew I purchased it with the bundle online. Every time I kept pressing the plan button in the app, it sent me to safari. Customer service takes a millennia to reach you. They could not figure out why my pro plan wasn‚Äôt activated to my account. 6 hours later, I went to their sign-in web page online. They made me redo all the naming for my sensors. I thought I was going to crash it since I had already done it. With much distress, I just continued to see what would happen. After renaming all my sensors, the giant activate pro plan page came up! Woo!!! I deleted my sensors in the Home app, reset the Abode app, then re-linked my sensors to Home app. BAM! Everything works fine now. All the scenes do what they are suppose to, and my sensors are fully functioning. I went back to the web app and adjusted my sensors and now the settings stay. I do not touch anything on the app only to disarm and arm if my internet is down. 
Overall, this app needs a lot of adjustments and bug squishing for new customers like me. I did get very stressed but I got everything working. I was very close to returning everything back if I could not get it working. Pro Plans and other subscriptions NEED to be accessible from the app. I gave this app two stars for all the headaches it caused me.
